cab.content: THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S GOVERNMENTSECRET. Copy No. 42CM. (46)55th Conclusions.CABINET 55 (46).CONCLUSIONS of a Meeting of the Cabinet held at 10 Downing Street, S.W. 1,on Wednesday, 5th June, 1946, at 10 a.m.Present:The Right Hon. C. R. Attlee, MThe Right. Hon. Herbert Morrison,MP, Lord President of the Council.The Right Hon. Arthur Greenwood,MP, Lord Privy Seal.The Right Hon. Lord Jowitt, LordChancellor.The Right Hon. Viscount Addison,Secretary of State for DominionAffairs.The Right Hon. J. J. Lawson, MP,Secretary of State for War.The Right Hon. E. Shinwell, MP,Minister of Fuel and Power.P, Prime Minister (in the Chair).The Right Hon. Ernest Bevin, MP,Secretary of State for ForeignAffairs.The Right Hon. Hugh Dalton, MP,Chancellor of the Exchequer.The Right Hon. J. Chuter Ede, MP,Secretary of State for the home department.The Right Hon. G. H. Hall, MP,Secretary of State for the Colonies.The Right Hon. J. Westwood, M.P,Secretary of State for Scotland.The Right Hon. Ellen Wilkinson,M.P, Minister of Education.The following were also present:Mr. Arthur Henderson, K.C, MP, Field-Marshal Viscount Alanbrooke,Parliamentary Under-Secretary of Chief of the Imperial General Staff.State for India.Admiral of the Fleet Viscount Marshal of the Royal Air Force LordCunningham of Hyndhope, First Sea Tedder, Chief of the Air Staff.Lord and Chief of Naval Staff.Field-Marshal Sir Claude Auchinleck,Commander-in-Chief, India.Secretariat.Sir Edward Bridges.General Sir Hastings Ismay.Sir Norman Brook.Mr. C. G. Eastwood.Contents.Subject. Page.India................ ................ 108Constitutional Position.[32264-1]Printed for the Cabinet. June 1946. India.constitutional position.(previous reference erence:CM. (46) 48thConclusions,Minute 4.)The Cabinet had before them a note by the Secretary (CP. (46)217) covering appreciations of the situation in India submitted bythe Cabinet Mission and the Viceroy.The Cabinets discussion is recorded in the Secretary's standard file of Cabinet Conclusions.Cabinet Office, S.W.1,5th June, 1946.
